text:
<https://status.HubSpot.com/>
This site shows the HubSpot teams known issues, and they report on the issues as they are resolving them.

As far as what to do if HS goes down, DNS change is all I can think of if it’s critical they get something up right away, but you’ll have a switching cost because when it’s safe to switch back your site might be “down” longer than just leaving it to HubSpot, as your DNS would have to be updated twice likely in the same day.

Having been developing on the platform for 4 years now, I can in my experience I’ve never seen HubSpot fully go down. I have seen momentary glitches where a specific feature doesn’t work as intended. but I think the way they do their servers and the use of cloudflare caching, adds a lot of stability.
Can I make this in HubSpot? - <https://github.com/discourse/discourse>
I'm afraid you wont be able to recreate this. HubSpot doesnt have a forum type product
unless you did some really really heavy customization with alot of other tools, but nothing I can think of off the top of my head

doesn't look like it at first glance. You could install on a VPS on digital ocean or something (using the docker install, linked on that readme) and forward a subdomain to it. ie <http://discourse.domainname.xyz|discourse.domainname.xyz>
but would be a lot of work (to customize to match your existing site, I mean)
:point_up: that's your best option
Does anyone have any experience with the Slate platform and if you can embed Slate forms on HubSpot pages?

Yeah, it might be possible... but probably would require a lot of custom work.

You might be better off trying to do a really slick integration of some sort.
hi, i have a question: how can we make the feature image in the “RSS listing” module have the link to the article?
Thank you for reply guys, really appreciated.
Hello all. I am having an issue where the cta scripts are not minifying. It includes the script a half dozen times on the page but doesnt minify it.
so
meetings
if i am making the meetings for a client, my name is the alt text for the logo
any way around that?
also does anyone know if you can send out a unique zoom link with the meeting invite?
Also if you want to see an example error page returned by HubSpot when we are down: <https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?adfasdf>
<@U6GNQ7JBU> how do you guys differentiate between when you’re going to use that vs our 500 error templates, just curious?

I believe the difference is when it is on our end vs your end. If someone hits an invalid path it will throw a 404 and show your template, however if there is something on our side like a failure to resolve a domain we will throw that more generic page. Similar to rendering your page: if there is a server exception due to rendering your page it will show your 500 template, however if there is a server exception related to even getting your page to the point it is rendered we throw the more general exception
the second question’s answer is no
when round robin
Thanks guys, very helpful :thumbsup:

So interesting Article from SEJ today: <https://www.searchenginejournal.com/seo-friendly-pagination/275557/>

My question, is HubSpot going to alter their pagination settings for these practices
for example, both of these settings are not recommended as best practice...
Will there be an option to have the blog listing pages have their own self referencing canonical?
it looks like HS does everything else correctly with the exception of this piece
I do not really agree with not adding pagenation pages to a site map.
another one of those moments as a developer where you go “I’m doing it all wrong…”
I completely agree with not adding pagination to a sitemap.
Example?
Yup, in that instance, I did the "Point to first page" because of the duplicate content from GSC, good to know now that Google doesnt really care and just lets you know about it as a heads up.
Wish they would of included that disclaimer
well pagination shouldn't be on a sitemap but I think the pages that are being paginated should be.
correct
:wink:
when does Harleyquin show up?
I added this as an idea to the forums: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Add-self-referencing-Canonical-URLs-to-blog-listing-pages-as-an/idi-p/215132#M24526>

I would fear if you include pagination in a sitemap they would do 2 negative things
• waste crawl time - Google stops crawling after x amount of time to move on to the next site, if you waste it on paginated pages that was litterally a waste
• since the items shown on the paginated pages change over time seems a waste
• Since the content on those listings is usually part duplicate content of whats on the actual detail pages, that’s duplicate content
What about on revamped content
re redo old posts and those older posts explode.
:shrug:
if they never get reindexed then then redoing older posts is futile
Case Example is a post that was getting ~300 visits per month. After redoing it weBZ now sees over 300per day on that one post
I don’t think indexing pagination however would result in that
I think their crawling of that post itself would result in that
in b4 inspirational words of :luke:
lol

What's up ya'll - Happy Monday :fiestaparrot: Anyone interested in helping other dev's in the community, check out <#CDSFETF5X|help-the-community>
> :point_right: In <#CDSFETF5X|help-the-community>, we are posting links to developer questions we find around the web (anywhere outside this slack).
> If you are an expert on a topic, it would be so cool if you could click on the link and help the person out. :pray:

This slack is amazzzzzing :amazing:, but not all questions make it into here. The <#CDSFETF5X|help-the-community> channel will help us aggregate them in one place. Any help would be brilliant. :raised_hands::skin-tone-2:
there are already a few questions in there :slightly_smiling_face:  Check it out: <#CDSFETF5X|help-the-community>
